The slithering, shapeless beings known as myrucarxes occasionally slip into the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) from their domains deep in the [Shadow Plane](/Equipment.aspx?ID=288), seeking to torment those who love light. Myrucarxes weave powerful illusions to draw unsuspecting victims into their squirming embrace, and they favor large cities as hunting grounds. Rather than devastate a community, a myrucarx instead prefers to snatch only a few victims to engender fear and paranoia, then retreat somewhere dark to hibernate for months or years before renewing its terrors. A myrucarx resembles a monstrous, oily slug with tentacles ending in gnashing jaws, but most victims only ever see the illusory personas it projects to lure and torment its prey. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 43 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 41 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 [Myrucarx](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1012) **Source** [Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale](/Sources.aspx?ID=51) pg. 85 **Perception** +33; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) (imprecise) 60 feet **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Shadowtongue](/Languages.aspx?ID=21) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +33, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +34, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +31, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +31, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +34 **Str** +9 **Dex** +6 **Con** +6 **Int** +5 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +6 **Odorless** A myrucarx emits no smell and can't be detected by [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33). --- **AC** 41 **Fort** +32 **Ref** +28 **Will** +30 **HP** 340 **Resistances** cold 20 **[Light Blindness](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=22)**
**Painful Light** When attempting a save against a [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100) effect, a myrucarx gets a result one degree of success lower than it rolled. A myrucarx caught in sunlight is [stunned 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) and [clumsy 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3). --- **Speed** 30 feet, climb 30 feet; [_freedom of movement_](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) **Melee** jaws +34 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+15 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Occult Innate Spells** DC 40, attack +32 - **2nd** [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (at will; self only) - **5th** [Hallucinatory Terrain](/Spells.aspx?ID=145) - **7th** [Chilling Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=36) (at will), [Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=59) (at will), [Mask of Terror](/Spells.aspx?ID=185) (self only), [Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222) (to [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) or [Shadow Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=11) only) - **9th** [Chilling Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=36), [Eclipse Burst](/Spells.aspx?ID=96), [Project Image](/Spells.aspx?ID=237) (at will; see illusory persona) - **Constant (8th)** [Freedom of Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) **Illusory Persona** The illusion created by the myrucarx's [_project image_](/Spells.aspx?ID=237) can resemble any Medium [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=91), including any specific individual it has seen, and has appropriate voice, scent, and mannerisms, allowing the myrucarx to use its [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) check to [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) that humanoid if it chooses. **Twisting Reach** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The fanged mouths at the ends of a myrucarx's tendrils twist around obstacles. The myrucarx makes two jaws Strikes against the same target, ignoring the target's cover. Both attacks count toward the myrucarx's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made. The myrucarx can't [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) as its next action after Twisting Reach.
Myrucarx Cabals Myrucarxes rarely defer to any other creature, but they grudgingly acknowledge the authority of cabals of powerful myrucarxes dwelling in deep caverns on the [Shadow Plane](/Equipment.aspx?ID=288). These cabals don't bother with the mundane work of terrorizing [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) cities; instead, they engage in worlds-spanning schemes to extinguish suns and create entire planets of cold, benighted horror.
name: Myrucarx
